alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Lincoln; McDuffie (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 06 at 5:00PM EDT until May 06 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... McDuffie County in east central Georgia... Northwestern Columbia County in east central Georgia... Southeastern Lincoln County in east central Georgia... * Until 545 PM EDT. * At 459 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Appling, or 10 miles northwest of Grovetown, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Thomson, Appling, Riverwood, Mistletoe State Park, Thomson-McDuffie County Airport, Wrightsboro, Dearing, Sweetwater Park, Winfield, McDuffie County Fire Department, Thomson Fire Department, McDuffie Regional Medical Center, Knox Scout Reservation, White Oak Campground, Boneville, Double Branches, Columbia County Jail, Wildwood Park, Ansley Mill and Eubank-Blanchard Community Center. This includes Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 167 and 184. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows. Severe thunderstorms can produce large capsizing waves and frequent lightning. If on or near Lake Strom Thurmond move away from the water and take shelter!
